meanings.definition: The characteristic quality of a sound, independent of pitch and loudness.
meanings.sent1: The timbre of her voice was soft and soothing.
meanings.sent2: The violin's timbre was rich and full.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at imitating a bird's timbre made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The timbre of the wind through the trees was like a gentle whisper.
meanings.sent5: The timbre of the bell echoed through the empty hall.

meanings.definition: The quality of a musical note or sound that distinguishes different types of musical instruments or voices.
meanings.sent1: The timbre of the trumpet was bright and brassy.
meanings.sent2: She could recognize the timbre of his guitar playing anywhere.
meanings.sent3: The timbre of the piano seemed to dance in the air.
meanings.sent4: His voice had the timbre of a seasoned storyteller.
meanings.sent5: The timbre of the flute floated delicately in the room.

meanings.definition: The color or tone of a musical sound.
meanings.sent1: The timbre of the drum was deep and resonant.
meanings.sent2: The singer adjusted her timbre to convey different emotions.
meanings.sent3: The timbre of the saxophone added a jazzy flair to the music.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a timbre that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The timbre of the cello filled the concert hall with warmth.
